channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: BoostTrack: boosting the similarity measure and detection confidence for improved multiple object tracking
item.description: To utilize low-detection score bounding boxes in one-stage association, we propose to boost the confidence scores of two groups of detections: the detections we assume to correspond to the existing tracked object, and the detections we assume to correspond to a previously undetected object.

item.title: Lyapunov-stable Neural Control for State and Output Feedback: A Novel Formulation for Efficient Synthesis and Verification
item.description: The flexibility and efficiency of our framework allow us to demonstrate Lyapunov-stable output feedback control with synthesized NN-based controllers and NN-based observers with formal stability guarantees, for the first time in literature.

item.title: TBSN: Transformer-Based Blind-Spot Network for Self-Supervised Image Denoising
item.description: For channel self-attention, we observe that it may leak the blind-spot information when the channel number is greater than spatial size in the deep layers of multi-scale architectures.

item.title: Taming Stable Diffusion for Text to 360Â° Panorama Image Generation
item.description: Generative models, e. g., Stable Diffusion, have enabled the creation of photorealistic images from text prompts.

item.title: RMAFF-PSN: A Residual Multi-Scale Attention Feature Fusion Photometric Stereo Network
item.description: Predicting accurate normal maps of objects from two-dimensional images in regions of complex structure and spatial material variations is challenging using photometric stereo methods due to the influence of surface reflection properties caused by variations in object geometry and surface materials.

item.title: Differentiable All-pole Filters for Time-varying Audio Systems
item.description: Infinite impulse response filters are an essential building block of many time-varying audio systems, such as audio effects and synthesisers.

item.title: Can Vehicle Motion Planning Generalize to Realistic Long-tail Scenarios?
item.description: We assess existing state-of-the-art planners on our benchmark and show that neither rule-based nor learning-based planners can safely navigate the interPlan scenarios.

item.title: Global versus Local: Evaluating AlexNet Architectures for Tropical Cyclone Intensity Estimation
item.description: The first model, trained on the entire dataset, is called the global AlexNet model.

item.title: Deep learning-driven pulmonary arteries and veins segmentation reveals demography-associated pulmonary vasculature anatomy
item.description: Here we propose a High-abundant Pulmonary Artery-vein Segmentation (HiPaS) framework achieving accurate artery-vein segmentation on both non-contrast CT and CTPA across various spatial resolutions.

item.title: Contrastive-Based Deep Embeddings for Label Noise-Resilient Histopathology Image Classification
item.description: Recent advancements in deep learning have proven highly effective in medical image classification, notably within histopathology.

item.title: Manipulating Large Language Models to Increase Product Visibility
item.description: We demonstrate that adding a strategic text sequence (STS) -- a carefully crafted message -- to a product's information page can significantly increase its likelihood of being listed as the LLM's top recommendation.

item.title: Diffusion posterior sampling for simulation-based inference in tall data settings
item.description: Determining which parameters of a non-linear model could best describe a set of experimental data is a fundamental problem in science and it has gained much traction lately with the rise of complex large-scale simulators (a. k. a.

item.title: Leveraging Data Augmentation for Process Information Extraction
item.description: Our study shows, that data augmentation is an important component in enabling machine learning methods for the task of business process model generation from natural language text, where currently mostly rule-based systems are still state of the art.

item.title: QuasiSim: Parameterized Quasi-Physical Simulators for Dexterous Manipulations Transfer
item.description: We explore the dexterous manipulation transfer problem by designing simulators.

item.title: HGRN2: Gated Linear RNNs with State Expansion
item.description: Hierarchically gated linear RNN (HGRN, Qin et al. 2023) has demonstrated competitive training speed and performance in language modeling, while offering efficient inference.

item.title: NeuroNCAP: Photorealistic Closed-loop Safety Testing for Autonomous Driving
item.description: We present a versatile NeRF-based simulator for testing autonomous driving (AD) software systems, designed with a focus on sensor-realistic closed-loop evaluation and the creation of safety-critical scenarios.

item.title: Inferring Change Points in High-Dimensional Linear Regression via Approximate Message Passing
item.description: We consider the problem of localizing change points in high-dimensional linear regression.

item.title: Scalable Language Model with Generalized Continual Learning
item.description: In this study, we introduce the Scalable Language Model (SLM) to overcome these limitations within a more challenging and generalized setting, representing a significant advancement toward practical applications for continual learning.

item.title: Streaming detection of significant delay changes in public transport systems
item.description: The method we propose can be used with different change detectors, such as ADWIN, applied to location data stream shuffled to individual edges of a transport graph.

item.title: Content-Adaptive Non-Local Convolution for Remote Sensing Pansharpening
item.description: In this paper, we introduce a so-called content-adaptive non-local convolution (CANConv), a novel method tailored for remote sensing image pansharpening.

item.title: Calibration of Continual Learning Models
item.description: Continual Learning (CL) focuses on maximizing the predictive performance of a model across a non-stationary stream of data.

item.title: Do You Remember? Dense Video Captioning with Cross-Modal Memory Retrieval
item.description: There has been significant attention to the research on dense video captioning, which aims to automatically localize and caption all events within untrimmed video.

item.title: Dealing with Subject Similarity in Differential Morphing Attack Detection
item.description: The advent of morphing attacks has posed significant security concerns for automated Face Recognition systems, raising the pressing need for robust and effective Morphing Attack Detection (MAD) methods able to effectively address this issue.

item.title: Behavior Trees Enable Structured Programming of Language Model Agents
item.description: Language models trained on internet-scale data sets have shown an impressive ability to solve problems in Natural Language Processing and Computer Vision.

item.title: Resolve Domain Conflicts for Generalizable Remote Physiological Measurement
item.description: Remote photoplethysmography (rPPG) technology has become increasingly popular due to its non-invasive monitoring of various physiological indicators, making it widely applicable in multimedia interaction, healthcare, and emotion analysis.

item.title: OpenTrench3D: A Photogrammetric 3D Point Cloud Dataset for Semantic Segmentation of Underground Utilities
item.description: We present OpenTrench3D, a novel and comprehensive 3D Semantic Segmentation point cloud dataset, designed to advance research and development in underground utility surveying and mapping.

item.title: Heron-Bench: A Benchmark for Evaluating Vision Language Models in Japanese
item.description: Vision Language Models (VLMs) have undergone a rapid evolution, giving rise to significant advancements in the realm of multimodal understanding tasks.

item.title: ai-research
item.description: None

item.title: Precise spiking motifs in neurobiological and neuromorphic data
item.description: Why do neurons communicate through spikes?

item.title: PillarTrack: Redesigning Pillar-based Transformer Network for Single Object Tracking on Point Clouds
item.description: LiDAR-based 3D single object tracking (3D SOT) is a critical issue in robotics and autonomous driving.

item.title: GoMVS: Geometrically Consistent Cost Aggregation for Multi-View Stereo
item.description: More specifically, we correspond and propagate adjacent costs to the reference pixel by leveraging the local geometric smoothness in conjunction with surface normals.

item.title: PINNACLE: PINN Adaptive ColLocation and Experimental points selection
item.description: Physics-Informed Neural Networks (PINNs), which incorporate PDEs as soft constraints, train with a composite loss function that contains multiple training point types: different types of collocation points chosen during training to enforce each PDE and initial/boundary conditions, and experimental points which are usually costly to obtain via experiments or simulations.

item.title: Post-Hoc Reversal: Are We Selecting Models Prematurely?
item.description: This phenomenon is especially prominent in high-noise settings.

item.title: Comments as Natural Logic Pivots: Improve Code Generation via Comment Perspective
item.description: In this paper, we suggest that code comments are the natural logic pivot between natural language and code language and propose using comments to boost the code generation ability of code LLMs.

item.title: Self-supervised Dataset Distillation: A Good Compression Is All You Need
item.description: In this work, we consider addressing this task through the new lens of model informativeness in the compression stage on the original dataset pretraining.

item.title: DesignQA: A Multimodal Benchmark for Evaluating Large Language Models' Understanding of Engineering Documentation
item.description: This research introduces DesignQA, a novel benchmark aimed at evaluating the proficiency of multimodal large language models (MLLMs) in comprehending and applying engineering requirements in technical documentation.

item.title: AnnoCTR: A Dataset for Detecting and Linking Entities, Tactics, and Techniques in Cyber Threat Reports
item.description: In our few-shot scenario, we find that for identifying the MITRE ATT&CK concepts that are mentioned explicitly or implicitly in a text, concept descriptions from MITRE ATT&CK are an effective source for training data augmentation.

item.title: From Words to Numbers: Your Large Language Model Is Secretly A Capable Regressor When Given In-Context Examples
item.description: We analyze how well pre-trained large language models (e. g., Llama2, GPT-4, Claude 3, etc) can do linear and non-linear regression when given in-context examples, without any additional training or gradient updates.

item.title: JetMoE: Reaching Llama2 Performance with 0.1M Dollars
item.description: Large Language Models (LLMs) have achieved remarkable results, but their increasing resource demand has become a major obstacle to the development of powerful and accessible super-human intelligence.

item.title: Transferable and Principled Efficiency for Open-Vocabulary Segmentation
item.description: In the context of efficient OVS, we target achieving performance that is comparable to or even better than prior OVS works based on large vision-language foundation models, by utilizing smaller models that incur lower training costs.

item.title: LLoCO: Learning Long Contexts Offline
item.description: We introduce LLoCO, a technique that combines context compression, retrieval, and parameter-efficient finetuning using LoRA.

item.title: Multi-view Aggregation Network for Dichotomous Image Segmentation
item.description: Dichotomous Image Segmentation (DIS) has recently emerged towards high-precision object segmentation from high-resolution natural images.

item.title: Guiding Large Language Models to Post-Edit Machine Translation with Error Annotations
item.description: Machine Translation (MT) remains one of the last NLP tasks where large language models (LLMs) have not yet replaced dedicated supervised systems.

item.title: Language Imbalance Can Boost Cross-lingual Generalisation
item.description: In controlled experiments on perfectly equivalent cloned languages, we observe that the existence of a predominant language during training boosts the performance of less frequent languages and leads to stronger alignment of model representations across languages.

item.title: Rho-1: Not All Tokens Are What You Need
item.description: After fine-tuning, Rho-1-1B and 7B achieved state-of-the-art results of 40. 6% and 51. 8% on MATH dataset, respectively - matching DeepSeekMath with only 3% of the pretraining tokens.

item.title: DGMamba: Domain Generalization via Generalized State Space Model
item.description: SPR strives to encourage the model to concentrate more on objects rather than context, consisting of two designs: Prior-Free Scanning~(PFS), and Domain Context Interchange~(DCI).

item.title: Monte Carlo Tree Search with Boltzmann Exploration
item.description: Monte-Carlo Tree Search (MCTS) methods, such as Upper Confidence Bound applied to Trees (UCT), are instrumental to automated planning techniques.

item.title: Curated Datasets and Neural Models for Machine Translation of Informal Registers between Mayan and Spanish Vernaculars
item.description: The Mayan languages comprise a language family with an ancient history, millions of speakers, and immense cultural value, that, nevertheless, remains severely underrepresented in terms of resources and global exposure.

item.title: ViM-UNet: Vision Mamba for Biomedical Segmentation
item.description: Here, we introduce ViM-UNet, a novel segmentation architecture based on it and compare it to UNet and UNETR for two challenging microscopy instance segmentation tasks.

item.title: Unsupervised Concept Drift Detection based on Parallel Activations of Neural Network
item.description: Practical applications of artificial intelligence increasingly often have to deal with the streaming properties of real data, which, considering the time factor, are subject to phenomena such as periodicity and more or less chaotic degeneration - resulting directly in the concept drifts.
